title: Remake  in solo/duo que changes
body:
So the story goes, ranked solo/duo queue. One of our laners got first blooded while our mid laner never joined the game, and as a result of the FB, remake was disabled.
It is in my opinion this should only be the case in a 5man premade (no longer solo/duo queue) situation.
The system is in place to prevent players faking afk to remake (giving themselves a loss) to save the team who got FB'd
In my experience, no one in solo/duo queue is going to willingly take a loss for 3-4 random people, let alone after it was the others who died.
I see no reason why this system should be in place in solo/duo queue, while I agree it becomes much more abusable in a 5-man premade, I can see(and have experienced) it causing far more harm than good in a solo/duo queue situation.

I have made this post to see how many people agree/disagree with me, and if it can potentially get riots attention in this matter

replies.body:
tho i voted yes, are you sure thats what happened? im almost certain fb doesnt cancel remakes. 
correct me and send link if im wrong.

Though I'm not sure of the exact timeline in this particular case:

>/Remake becomes available at 3:00 if a player is disconnected or flagged as inactive for 90 seconds. **First blood against a player's team before they leave/dc will prevent a /remake vote.
